Name: Quarreling: the card game
Description:
Quarreling: the card game is a board game designed for couples and lovers to avoid their quarrels. Draw cards, play cards and count emotion points. He/She who gains the most points would win this game, but may also give u a sorry kiss. 
To my love Flaw.

Name: Endemic
Description:
Endemic pits two players controlling medical workers against a third player who controls a pair of diseases.

From the site:
"In a far away planet two diseases are starting to spread. A team has been called forth to fight the diseases off. But it seems the diseases have a mind of their own..."

Name: Confugo
Description: Confugo (from Latin: "I take refuge") is a simple but addictive roll-and-move board game, suitable for players aged from 7 onwards. The objective is to move your pieces from one end of the board to the other whilst attacking your opponent's pieces and defending yourself.  In each move players have to decide whether to attack, defend or play safe. The winner is the first player to get all their pieces to safety.

Name: Transformers Animated Board Game
Description: Welcome to Detroit, Autobots! Your mission is to protect Earth from the evil Decepticons and other enemies. Travel through the city in search of enemies to defeat. Try to be the first Autobot to reach Sumdac's Tower and battle Megatron and you're the winner!

Name: RunAway Train
Description:
The train car you are on has broken away from the rest of the train, slowed to a stop, and now is heading back down the hill, towards the Train Station that's overlooking a canyon. The car is barely moving, but seems to be picking up speed, the smart thing to do would be to jump now...but, there still some time and the car is not moving that fast yet, you are sure you can toss off some your suitcases (with all your ill-gotten gains) before you have to jump. Too bad the other passengers seem to have the same idea.

The object of the game is to score the most points by getting  your suitcases off the train car. Suitcases have a point value from 1-7 points. There are also bonuses and score multipliers that can increase the points earned. You will at some point want to get your passenger off the train, because if the train does crash (which is very, very likely) you don't want to be on it.

Name: Piston Cup Board Game
Description:
Lightning McQueen, Chick Hicks and The King are dead even as they screech into the final lap of the Piston Cup! Who will take the trophy home? Play your cards right and it could be you!

Be the first player to score 10 checkered flag points by correctly guessing the order that the cars finish the race.

Name: Heavy Gear Tactical Miniatures Rules
Description:
From the back of the book:

Terra Nova is a land full of beauty and mystery: rolling grasslands, rocky precipices, misty jungles, thick forests and harsh deserts. Through them all, the military forces of Terra Nova wage their deadly contests in the hopes of besting one another. The Heavy Gear Tactical Miniatures Rulebook now allows players to experience this struggle in miniature play format. This rulebook includes:
- Quick Start Rules to allow you to get a game up and running in no time, whether in Tactical, Skirmish or Toy modes;
- Advanced rules, such as Hull Down, Burst Fire and Detailed Damage to spark up gameplay;
- Instructions and techniques on building and painting miniatures and terrain, presented in glorious color;
- Basic listings for the Northern Guard, Southern MILICIA and Earth CEF armies;
- Rules for building your own combat regiment or Rover band and upgrading your vehicles with extra equipment;
- Six ready-to-play scenarios plus a detailed generator to construct your own.
A few six-sided dice, miniatures, pen and paper are required to play the game.

Stock number: DP9-106

Name: Scrip-Tour -- The Bible Book Game
Description: Bible Rack-O. Players attempt to arrange cards, each bearing the name of one of the books of the Bible, in their personal racks in biblical sequence. In standard Rack-O fashion, cards can be drawn from either the face down draw deck or the face up discard pile and must then be placed in the same slot from which the old card was removed. First to fill their rack in correct sequence wins.

Name: Passion: Closer Together
Description:
Passion is a board game designed for lover's that want to have fun and spice things up by learning more about what each other want and like. You and your lover will be entertained for hours as you challenge each other for favor cards and try to stay away from penalty cards. Each step along the way will be a sensual experience and sexual exploration. Main goal is to gather points to win. And a winner will get...well who knows!!!

Games are a fun and healthy way to change things up a bit in your sex life. Pulling one out from under the bed every now and again can turn a night of love-making into a special romantic event.

This game includes 162 cards (Challenge, Favor, and Penalty), a game board, 2 tokens, a notepad, a blindfold, 2 spin dials, and 2 pencils.

Name: France Quiz Junior
Description: France trivia game now has a junior version. Packed with 1500 fun questions that every child should know about the their country – music, sport, geography, nature, culture and much more

Name: France Quiz Voyage
Description: The travel version of the France Quiz. The game includes a total of 600 France concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!

Name: Pop & Rock: Frågespel om svensk musik
Description: An entertaining Question game where you can measure your knowledge of the English pop & rock music. You know who wrote the song "Teddy Bear Fredriksson? or who won "Idol 2006"? Contains 2400 questions and answers in six categories, text lines, songwriters, and mixed by a unique collaboration Includes also radio Vinyl 107, Classic Rock and Mix Megapol as a separate category. Collect a CD of all six categories and respond to the last issues to be the most and who can win the game.

Name: Smart 7 Jorden runt
Description: Here, the first to reach seven correct answers is the winner. Smart Games are different compared to other issues. For each correct answer you win a badge in your color. The fewer questions you need to take advantage of seven correct answers. The faster you can collect your seven tiles the faster you win the round / game. Each game includes 700 questions and answers in which the post operates as the short clips. In addition, 28 smart cards, a protocol blocks and game rules.

Name: Smart 7 Junior Fantasi och äventyr
Description: Here, the first to reach seven correct answers is the winner. Smart Games are different compared to other games like that. For each correct answer you win a badge in your color. The fewer questions you need to take advantage of seven correct answers, the faster you can collect your seven tiles and win the round / game. Each game includes 700 questions and answers in which the post operates as the short clips. In addition, 28 smart cards, a protocol blocks and game rules.

Name: Familjens frågespel
Description: Experience the laughter and excitement in the family's favorite issues. Here the issues 385 fun topics about anything and everything, from animals in Africa and subscribed magazines to mobile phones and planets. The questions fit to the whole family and also special issues for the youngest. Answer the questions in your favorite subject and try to win as much money as possible on your skills. When the timer starts ticking, you have 15 seconds for you to respond. While stressing players you through placing the chance card that means they probably know the answer and want to "steal" your question. The player with the most money at the game's final will be the family champion.

Name: Funny Faces
Description: In this crazy and fun game, the player is, what animal and human faces tell about their personality. You may both comical male and female faces as different animal portraits. Players may turn put faces and read out the various weird claims like "Not sure about their sexual orientation." Since voting players individually which of the five faces that they think best meet this claim. Those who are in the majority may move up their game pieces on the board. The first player who will win in goal in this extremely entertaining game for adults.

Name: Norge quiz extreme
Description: 2400 questions that interested community will love! Finally, ask a game that only raises the issue of what is important and interesting, namely the development in the Norwegian society after 1945. The new and exciting categories are tailored for those looking for a real challenge. The new categories are: Politics, Business, Norwegian ideas, Media, Norwegians abroad and Events and social development.

Name: Norge quiz travel
Description: An interesting quiz game about the Norway - now in a handy travel size edition! The game includes 600 questions divided into six categories, which are History, Culture, Science, Goegraphy, Sport and Miscellaneous.

Name: Norge Quiz Junior
Description: This popular trivia game now has a junior version. Packed with fun questions that every child should know about the their country – films, books, sport, fun places to visit and much more. Answer a question correctly from each category as you move around the board and try to collect tokens. The first player to collect 6 tokens wins.

Name: Crazy Business
Description: An exciting and fun business games for the whole family where you can take risks in hazard games. If you like to buy and sell, your best bet is probably to obtain land and sites for building banks and casinos. If, on the other hand, you like to play on the casino, this may be your biggest source of income - you can be rich in a snap. Do not forget to think about how you invest your money - everything is possible when it comes Crazy Business.

Name: Danmark Quizzen om dit land Junior
Description: This popular trivia game now has a junior version. Packed with fun questions that every child should know about the their country – films, books, sport, fun places to visit and much more. Answer a question correctly from each category as you move around the board and try to collect tokens. The first player to collect 6 tokens wins.

Name: Danmark Quizzen om dit land Junior travel
Description: The game includes a total of 600 Denmark concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!

Name: Danmark Quizzen om dit land Rejespil
Description: Travel version of the popular game. The game includes a total of 600 Finland concerning questions! By responding to the questions you tick off the pyramid in your subject areas. You be the first to check off 5 circles, you are a winner!

Name: Tina Lund World Cup
Description: Do you dream about that being a horse riding beautiful Tina Lund? If so, the own game "Tina Lund World Cup", you get chance for that display your talents in the exciting game. To compete in the start of a borrowed horse and will be at collecting as many prizes together as possible, so to get your very own horse. When you do this, you should be able to compete with your own horse. Chance cards and sport questions make "Tina Lund World Cup" to a fun and active game. You also get chance for that to compete with different horses, and the better the rider, the better horse, you get points. Many of the horses are "untrained" and is the real challenge, you may be allowed to run with Tina Lund real horse Carola! Winner is the one who gets the famous Carola!

Name: Nederland Kids Kwizzz
Description: This popular trivia game now has a junior version. Packed with fun questions that every child should know about the their country – films, books, sport, fun places to visit and much more. Answer a question correctly from each category as you move around the board and try to collect tokens. The first player to collect 6 tokens wins.

Name: Lietuva: Viskas, ką lietuvis turi žinoti
Description: Game "Lithuania" - all you need to know Lithuanian! In this game you will find interesting questions and answers on history, culture, nature, geography and sports themes. It is intriguing quiz, where you can play in teams or individually. Game "Lithuania" consists of six questions topics, 400 papers, 2400 questions with answers.

Name: Lilly the Witch
Description: 12 playing pieces with different symbols on front and back are laid out in 4 quartes of the playing area. One player takes the Hektor figure. The other players try to memorize the symbols (6 different). Then they close their eyes. “Hektor” flips one playing piece and the other players open their eyes again. Now they try to find out, which piece was flipped. The one who detects the piece first AND can tell which symbol is on the back, earns the piece nad will be the new “Hektor” for the next round.  A new piece is laid out. To win the game, you must collect 5 pieces.

Name: Sediq Song: Wushe Incident 1930
Description:
Sediq Songï¼ˆè³½å¾·å…‹ä¹‹æ­Œï¼‰is a two-player postcard wargame and it simulates the Wushe Incident, October 27 to December 8, 1930.  Each turn represents one week and the map represents the Taichu Prefecture ï¼ˆå°ä¸­å·žï¼‰.  One player commands the Japanese colonial forcesï¼ˆæ—¥æœ¬æ®–æ°‘æ”¿åºœï¼‰and the other player commands the Sediq warriorsï¼ˆè³½å¾·å…‹æ—å‹‡å£«ï¼‰.  Japanese army will fail the battle if at least one Sediq warrior survives in Wushe division in the end of the sixth-turn.

It is the first postcard wargame of the Aboriginal Tribal Battles series designed by Formosa Force Games.

Name: Kimavu
Description:
Two children play hide and seek in the garden of the house. The first to find the other is the winner.

A deducation game for two children. Each player takes a grid map of a garden, and play on either side of the screen. The gardens has a number of unique items in each column and row.

Taking turns, each players rolls two dice. One die shows the number of questions they may ask the other player to discern their location. The other die is the number of spaces the player may move their pawn.

When they suspect they are in the same square as the opponent, the player announces their location. If it is the same, the player wins.

Name: Super OVNI
Description:
"The 2000 year's game"

Game similar to connect 4, but played on a diamond shaped board of 11x10. The game ends when all the board is filled an then all the lines of 4 or more are scored. The player with the higher total score wins. 
Scoring:
4 in a row...1 point
5 in a row...2 points
6 in a row...3 points
etc...

El juego del año 2000

Juego similar a las 4 en raya, pero con tablero en forma de diamante de 11x10. El juego finaliza cuando se ha llenado todo el tablero y se puntúan todas las líneas de más de 4 fichas, ganando el jugador que más puntuación total ha conseguido.

La forma de puntuar es la siguiente:
4 en línea... 1 punto
5 en línea....2 puntos
6 en linea....3 puntos
etc.

Name: Pico Pico
Description:
The players are small animals trying to steal seeds from an angry woodpecker by hiding under the eggs in its nest.

Play starts by releasing the woodpecker. As it slides down towards the nest, players take turn rolling a die. Using the symbol revealed the players move one egg around the nest. Just be sure to remember which egg your animal is hiding under.

When the woodpecker reaches the nest, the player holding the die is caught and gets nothing that round. If the other players are alone in part of the nest, then they receive one seed.

The woodpecker is released again and a new round begins. This repeats until all the seeds have been stolen. The player with the most wins.

Name: Asalto Espacial
Description:
Based in the Asalto game, but using two joined boards. The players are attackers and defenders at the same time.

The objective of the game is to occupy the 9 spaces that defended the other player, or the destruction of his attack spaceships, or the immobilization of his deffense spaceships. In each turn the player can move an attack or deffense ship. The defense ships can move in all directions. Attack ships are limited to advance by the blue lines, not being able to use the green ones. The movement is realised square by square. The deffense ships can also eliminate the attacking ones like checkers. If they dont't do it then the deffense ship is retired from the board temporaly. A player can get back a deffense ship when he conquer a square of the last free line with his attack ship.


"Ataque y defensa con naves interplanetarias"Juego basado en el juego del Asalto, pero en el que se han unido dos tableros y los jugadores han de ser tanto atacantes como defensores.

El objetivo del juego es ocupar los 9 espacios que defendidos por el contrario, o por la destrucción sus naves de ataque, o la inmobilización de sus naves de defensa.

En cada turno el jugador podrá mover una nave de ataque o una de defensa. Las naves de defensa pueden mover en todas direcciones, mientras que las de ataque están limitadas a avanzar por las lineas azules, no pudiendo usar las verdes. El movimiento se realiza casilla a casilla, menos cuando una nave de defensa puede eliminar una nave atacante, haciéndolo como el el juego de las damas. Al igual que las damas el comer es obligatorio y si no se lleva a cabo la nave defensora puede ser "soplada". Las naves "sopladas" pueden reintegrarse al juego desde el centro del tablero si se ha conquistado alguna casilla de la última línea libre.

Name: Klotrix Trivia
Description: Klotrix Trivia is a promotional product for the Potassium Suppliment Klotrix. The game features general knowledge trivia questions and a special board with a track modeled after the patented fast release of Klotrix. On certain squares, players are allowed to answer an additional question to skip ahead on the track. The winner is the first person to make it back to their starting area.

Name: Kirby the Board Game
Description:
Kirby the Board Game is a children's roll and move game based on the popular Nintendo video game character. The game features a double sided board with a different map on each side. Movement is determined by drawing numbered cards. One of the cards causes the player to lose their turn. The winner is the first player around the board.

The game was given away in Wendy's Kids' Meals.

Name: Ticket to Ride: Europa 1912
Description:
The Ticket to Ride Europa 1912 expansion for the Ticket to Ride series includes 101 Destination Tickets - the 46 original tickets, plus 55 new ones that enable 3 new variants to the Ticket to Ride Europe map: Europe Expanded, which adds 19 new routes to the original 46; Big Cities of Europe, with tickets to 9 major European cities; and Mega Europe, which uses all the new routes as well as the 46 original Destination Tickets.

This expansion also introduces Warehouses & Depots - new game rules and pieces that create an additional strategic layer and can be played with any of the Ticket to Ride maps. Wooden Train Depots are placed on cities selected by each player. Throughout the game, each player's Warehouse will accumulate Train cards and those who have the foresight, clever timing, or just plain good fortune to build a route to a Depot can make off with a fistful of Train cards. Depot placement and skillful Warehouse tactics become a key part of a winning Ticket to Ride strategy!

Part of Ticket to Ride series.

Name: Sunshine Cheez-It Scrabble Junior
Description: Simplified version of Scrabble Junior published on the back of a box of Cheez-Its.  Game is played using Cheez-Its  with letters on them as the tiles.

Name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Valkrill's Gambit
Description:
Valkrill's Gambit is the tenth Small Expansion Set (wave 10) in the HeroScape series.  It is the first expansion that contained repainted figures, repackaged figures or rereleased figures.

There are 4 booster packs: 
Warriors of Feldspar (repaints of Dzu-Teh and Obsidian Guards)
Champions of Renown (repackaged GenCon and Walmart exclusives)
Soulborgs (rerelease of wave 5 booster pack)
Warriors and Soulborgs (rerelease of wave 5 booster pack)

Each pack contains 4-7 figures and no glyphs.  The wave 5 rereleases contain terrain pieces.

Name: Battleship: G.I. JOE The Rise of Cobra Edition
Description: The battle between G.I. Joe™ and Cobra™ is about to begin! In this edition of BATTLESHIP, fall in with the heroic G.I. Joe team or suit up and fight for the cold-blooded Cobra. Call out coordinates and mark your hits and misses against your opponent. Once a fleet is destroyed, remove the mission sheet from the command unit to reveal the battlefield. For the first time ever, you’ll seek and destroy your enemy on land, at sea, and in the air- it’s the most versatile BATTLESHIP game yet!

Name: Blink Solitaire
Description:
A cross between what's recognized as the Windows Solitaire game (aka Klondike), dominoes, and Blink.

This is a single-player game where players lay down cards where the shorter width ends of cards touch the longer length sides of cards (Blink standard deck) and all touch only where there is at least one of number, color, or suite match.  Going off the edge of a table to match cards legally is a lost game, as is not being able to place a card next to other existing cards that match on at least one attribute for all edges that touch.

This game may take 40 minutes with a single deck.

Name: Crag
Description:
Why do people climb rockfaces - because they are there and because they can.  Well you can if the conditions are right!

In Crag they are always right.  Crag is a solo dice and card game that tries to simulate some of experience of rock climbing.  A route is generated from deck of cards and then the player attempts to move up it.  The longer the route, the harder the moves the more tired they become.  Placing gear can help if you fall, but it won't stop you falling, and you only have so much gear.

The files for Crag can be found in the files section.

Name: Med Döderhultarn på världsomsegling till Blå Jungfrun
Description:
"Döderhultarn" is the colloquial name for a Swedish artist (woodcarver) called Axel Petersson (1868-1925). "Blå Jungfrun" ("The Blue Maiden") is a small island outside of Sweden which is a nature reserve since 1926. Apparently Döderhultarn was a bit excentric, and also very fond of the island. This game tries to encompass all this in a story of how he travels all over the world before actually reaching Blå Jungfrun.

The game consists of a single sheet of paper, 76 x 54 cm, folded twice to create a thin booklet. Each space the players move through has a small illustration and a short verse, describing what happens.

The game is published to benefit "Svenska typografförbundets invalid- och tuberkulosfonder", the Swedish typographer union's invalid and tuberculosis funds.

Name: Wyprawa na Proxima Centauri
Description:
Game is a unique adventure in Science and Fiction. It is an unforgettable journey of the first astronauts into Proxima Centauri - the closest start apart from the sun.
In the journey to Proxima Centauri - space ships will encounter different real and imagined situations, will meet U.F.O. and other civilizations.

This is a pretty simple game where one player aims to reach Proxima Centauri (rockets), while other one tries not to let it happen (UFO). On the top of it - there is a number of additional events in the space eventually - having impact on the game.

Game was designed originally in Poland and was never translated to other lanuages.

Name: Hei me pelataan ulkopolitiikkaa!
Description: A simple Trivial Pursuit clone. All the questions are from the areas of politics and political history.

Name: Class Clown
Description:
From the game envelope: "In Class Clown players take turns as the teacher of an unruly class.  When you are not the teacher, you want to be as far away from her as possible so that you can get into the most trouble"

Contents: 24 numbered cards (1-6 in 4 colors), 4 Class Clown cards and 1 rule sheet. Also has 4 advertisement cards.

One d6 and a way to keep score are also needed.

Name: Monster House
Description:
Epidemic pits two players controlling a group of friends against a third player who controls a monster.

From the site:
"It's the middle of the night and you and your friends in a haunted house. You are trapped inside and your only way out is by killing the monster before he kills you."

Name: Groovy Girls Bingo
Description:
This game is a Groovy Girls version of classic Bingo with a few differences; instead of numbers the cards are filled with various Groovy Girl characters, and a deck of cards with the characters are used as call outs instead of numbered balls.  The first person to complete a row wins!

Contents in special metal box:
-4 double sided Bingo cards (4x4) grid
-32 call out cards
-44 markers
-Game Rules

Name: Baa Baa Moo
Description:
From the designer's Etsy listing (Etsy seller fun4thecar):

I created this card game for younger children, but when different people started playing with them, we found out that teenagers and adults laughed uncontrollably as they tried to shout out the right animal sounds!

This game is made out of laminated paper (with rounded corners). Rules: Cards are placed down one at a time. Two players see who can make the correct animal sound first. The person who makes the correct sound first, holds on to the card. When the rabbit card appears - don't make a sound! If you do - you lose one of your cards. It helps to have a judge, too, to determine who shouts out the right sound first. Whoever ends up with the most cards in the end wins.

Name: Jungle Speed: Scooby-Doo
Description:
A version of Jungle Speed designed for younger, but always the same goal: Be the fastest to grab the totem and get rid of your cards!

Comes with a Scooby Doo totem, Bag, 72 cards, and 8 special cards

Name: Sports Dice: Football
Description:
From the back of the box:

ABC's Monday Night Football Game

For over 25 years, ABC's Monday Night Football has brought you the most talked about action-packed football games of each season.  Now you can pass, run and play defense along with your team in this fast-paced football dice game.  It is a game of strategy and luck - each player trying to outwit their opponent just like the pros.  Keep track of the plays up and down the field on the full colour football field game board.  Includes everything needed to play.

Includes:

6 Special Dice
Football Field Game Board
Non-toxic Erasable Marking Pen
Rules

Name: The Quintana Game
Description:
This game is aimed at recreating the events celebrated in The Quintana, held in Ascoli Piceno in Le Marche, Italy on the first Sunday in August.  This pageant remembers the political in-fighting that raged in the town during the early Renaissance.

Up to 6 factions struggle to provide the best jouster to claim the rights as the top faction for the coming year.

This is a roll and move game where you have to occasionally answer trivia questions about the Quintana.  There isn't much for gamers here but, for those who've seen the Qunitana, it is an evocative rendition of the events in game form with all the components coloured according to the flags of the 6 factions.

Name: Wings of War: The Last Biplanes Squadron Pack
Description:
New Squadron pack for the Wings of War series set in second world war. Two biplanes that fought on all European and African fronts are featured: the Gloster Gladiator (in Mk. I, Mk. II and Sea Gladiator variants) and the Fiat Cr.42 Falco. From Belgium to Finland, from Hungary to Norway, many nations started the war with these beautiful and agile machines. Even Chinese Gladiators are included in the set, to reenact air duels over Asia even before WW2 started.

It contains 28 airplane cards and 2 'L' Maneuver Decks.

Part of the Wings of War series.

Name: Oitavos
Description:
"The Oitavos game rules and play draw their inspiration from the actual history and architecture of the Fort of São Jorge de Oitavos. However they were not intended to replicate them exactly. We have created a version that allows everyone to participate in make believe history, and to learn even more about Cascais. Since this is a game, the main goal always is to have fun. The game celebrates the magnificent heritage of the town of Cascais.

The game is for 2 to 6 players who play the role of pirates trying to land and capture the greatest number of barrels of supplies. For age 8 and up. 40 to 60 minute game time."

Name: The Puzzling Pyramid
Description:
In The Puzzling Pyramid, each player builds a maze on the side of a pyramid for another to navigate, sight unseen. They then race each other to the top, turn by turn.

Four triangular pyramid faces sit atop a base. On the reverse of a player's pyramid face, you build a maze by placing a number of baffles between posts (at least one route must be provided, and handicapping can be achieved by limiting a player's number of baffles). The pyramid is then rotated a quarter turn so that each player faces a different side of the pyramid. On a player's turn, you use a magnetic wand on the surface to move a steel ball up through the maze on the back, toward the top of the pyramid. If the ball encounters a baffle, it's separated from the wand and drops to the bottom of the base. If a player is unsuccessful, the turn passes until on a subsequent turn someone successfully navigates to the top.

Name: Chytrý zajíček
Description: Once upon a time bunny makes up his mind that he invites his friends for a visit. Who finds the most carrots is the winner. Game practices memory, attention and patience.

Name: Kris Kros Pro Deti
Description: Board game with words for children. Words you create as in crossword. For the youngest there is board game with pictures, for older children there is classical board game.

Name: The Little Mole and Letters
Description: Game is dedicated to small children who are just discovering the alphabet. Game contents board game with illustrations of favourite the Little Mole and his friends. Children complete simple words with firing letters onto preprinted boxes. By the firing the last letter of the word gets player chip as a point. Who has got the most points is the winner. Game practice memory, thinking, lexicon, language skills and patience.

Name: Blondie Playing Card Game
Description: Early 1940's card game featuring the comic strip legends.  The cards feature full color cartoon scenes from the Blondie comic strip.

Name: Charlie Chan Card Game
Description: Late 1930's card game featuring the fictional Chinese-American detective

Name: Liberty Flag Game
Description: 1940's card game of Flag identification and matching.

Name: Mickey Mouse's Treasure Hunt
Description: A food premium game issued by Post Toasties.  Simple spin and move game taking you around a track that features Mickey.

Name: Steve Allen's Qubila
Description: As the name implies - this is a Word game played by rolling cubes and spelling words.

Name: Tiddle Tower
Description:
"The Snap-up Game of Lively Jumps"

1930's dexterity game of flicking jacks into containers mounted on a pole.

Name: Tollroad Turnpike
Description: Educational, easy to play game that featured some cool mini cars.  The game is a simple spin and move around the track style of game. Game features Chevrolet, Aston Matin, Bentley and Van Wall brand cars.

Name: Chrononauts: The Gore Years
Description:
An 11 card expansion to Chrononauts that adds timeline cards and patches for the years 2000 to 2008, and new characters that are affected by events in that time period.

Publisher Blurb:

Chrononauts is now more than ten years old, and it's showing its age. A lot has happened in the 21st century, but the TimeLine stops at 1999!

Introducing the Gore Years, an 11 card expansion for Chrononauts which extends the TimeLine from 2000 to 2008. The set includes 5 new TimeLine cards, 3 new Patches, and 3 new Characters who depend on this new strip of TimeLine.

Released in two editions: the "First" came with an additional "title card" and was packaged in a small ziptop-style bag. The current edition comes in a more traditional wrapped card pack minus the "title card".

Name: Northern Guard Army List
Description:
From the back of the book:

The Northern Guard is the main armed force of the North and leading the fight against the Southern MILICIA. It is an integrated army ready to take on all comers and hand them a resounding defeat. The pride of the North, the Guard fields a devastating combination of Gears, armor and infantry, ideal for fighting in the deserts, forest and jungles of Terra Nova.
The Northern Guard Army List provides Heavy Gear tactical Players with all the information they need to run battles featuring the Guard and build their own Guard units. Northern Guard land forces are covered in detail along with guidelines for building miniature armies, new tactical abilities for special units and some historical background on the Guard.
The Army List includes:
- Details on over 70 standard squadron types, including 27 Gear squadrons, 3 strider squadrons, 24 infantry squads and 18 armored squadrons. Each squadron includes unique tactical abilities and optional vehicle modifications.
- Rules for building your own Northern Guard regiment.
- Seven new Gear and tank variants unique to the Northern Guard.
- Full details on five famous regiment, including their commanders, special squadrons and unique tactical abilities. Each regiment is ready to play.
- Background details on the Guard, including strategy, medals, uniforms and standard equipment.

Stock Number: DP9-046

Name: Southern Milicia Army List
Description:
From the back of the book:

MILICIA is an acronym which stands for MILitary Intervention/Counter-Insurgency Army. The Southern MILICIA recruits troops from all four Southern leagues; they are used to staff border outpost and perform counter-insurgency duty in the three vassal leagues. Most importantly, they spearhead the fighting against the South's enemies, taking the fight to protect their own across Terra Nova.
The Southern MILICIA Army List provides Heavy Gear tactical Players with all the information they need to run battles featuring the MILICIA and to buid their own MILICIA units. Southern land forces are covered in detail along with guidelines for building miniature armies, new tactical abilities for special units and some historical background on the MILICIA.
The Army List includes:
- Details on over 70 standard cadre types, including 27 Gear cadres, 3 strider cadres, 24 infantry squads and 18 armored squadrons. Each squadron includes unique tactical abilities and optional vehicle modifications.
- Rules for building your own Southern MILICIA regiment.
- New Gear and tank variants unique to the Southern MILICIA.
- Full details on five famous regiments, including their commanders, special squadrons and unique tactical abilities. Ech regiment is ready to play.
- Background details on the MILICIA, including strategy, medals, uniforms and standard equipment.

Stock number: DP9-048.

Name: Heavy Gear Tactical Pack One: Battle of Two Towers
Description:
From the back of the book:

The Battle of Two Towers tactical campaign pack is a full tactical campaign for use with the Heavy Gear tactical system. The booklet features two brand new regiments, the Northern Guard's 77th Heavy Gear Regiment (The Screaming Banshees), and the MILICIA's 121st Gear Regiment (The Fortunate Ones), and a bundle of scenarios that can be played independently or as part of the campaign. The pack also includes two maps and three counter sheets.

Stock number: DP9-050.

Name: Heavy Gear Tactical Pack Two: Shadow War
Description:
From the back of the book:

The Shadow War tactical campaign pack is a full tactical campaign for use with the Heavy Gear tactical system. The booklet features two brand new regiments, the 42nd Combined Company (Death Jesters) and the 68th Companie (Chasseurs d'Ombres), and a bundle of scenarios that can be played independently or as part of the campaign. The pack also includes two maps and three counter sheets.

Stock number: DP9-054.

Name: Heavy Gear Tactical Pack Three: Operation Sudden Fire
Description:
From the back of the book:

The Operation Sudden Fire tactical campaign pack is a full tactical campaign for use with the Heavy Gear tactical system. The booklet features two brand new units, the 13th Northern Gear Regiment, Charlie Company (Death Knells) and the remnants of the MILICIA's 127th Regiment (Carrion Serpents), and a bundle of scenarios that can be played independently or as part of the campaign. The pack also includes two maps and three counter sheets.

Stock number: DP9-056.

Name: Heavy Gear Armor Pack Volume One: Tanks & Striders
Description:
Contains six 8.5x11" full-color counter sheets and a 16-page black and white booklet, with four tactical scenarios and game stats for 44 Terranovan combat vehicles.

Stock number: DP9-057.

Name: Fredi Ja Batonaator Loomaias
Description:
Come and join Fredi and Batonator at the zoo.
Fredi and Batonator brought the inhabitants of the zoo eight sacks of masts that children had collected. Then they decided to find their old buddies Panda Bear and Marabou Bird. Let's see who's going to be the first to find Panda Bear and Marabou Bird!
You can start the journey by rolling 1 or 6 with the die.
It's the first game in the "Fredi ja Batonaatori seiklused" set out of the four!
Families: TV Shows: Fredi Ja Batonaatori Seiklused

Name: Fredi Mereseiklus
Description:
On the nice sea expedition on the warm southern sea, Fredi happens to find small treasure - a pretty string of pearls and a beautiful ancient oil can from an old sunken shipwreck at the bottom of the sea. He is eager to tell his best friend Batonator about his find right away. But unfortunately Batonator had stayed basking on the palm island. The voyage to this faraway and secluded island is not easy. Compete with Fredi - the one who is the first to surprise Batonator with the treasure, will be the winner. 
Second game in the set "Fredi ja Batonaatori seiklused" out of four.
Families: TV Shows: Fredi Ja Batonaatori Seiklused

Name: Palju Õnne, Fredi!
Description:
You and Batonator are invited to Fredi's birthday. You can start the journey from France or Holland! Be the first to get to the birthday party and win!
Third game in the set of "Fredi ja Batonaatori seiklused" out of four!
Families: TV Shows: Fredi Ja Batonaatori Seiklused

Name: Fredi ja Batonaator kosmoses
Description:
In this game you will be astronaut who will be the first in the Universe to reach the periphery of Galaxy at billions of light years where no one has ever been. Be there first and win, but be careful, there are a lot obstacles in your way! Be clever and smart!
Final fourth game in the set of "Fredi aj Batonaatori seiklused".
Families: TV Shows: Fredi Ja Batonaatori Seiklused

Name: Pop-A-Word
Description:
Pop-A-Word is a word-forming dice game, self-contained in the familiar Kohner Pop-O-Matic mechanism.

On a player's turn, the tray containing nine letter cubes is popped and jiggled until lying flat in the center. The player then makes the highest-scoring word possible from the letters showing face-up, the score being the total of the point values on the letters used in the word. Letters cannot be used multiple times unless showing on multiple faces, and a blank can be used for any letter, though that letter scores 0. Bonuses of an extra turn and extra points are earned for words of 6 to 9 letters. The game continues until a player reaches 200 points or some other agreed-upon total.

There is an alternate game where all players form his or her own word simultaneously from the same pop.

Name: Nitty Gritty
Description:
Twenty-four square tiles are to be placed in a 5x5 tray (the center square is not playable); a player is eliminated when the player cannot make legal move; the last player to move, wins.

Each tile is a 2x2 square array of one of three colors - each permutation, ignoring rotation, is represented once among the tiles.

The game can be played solitaire as a puzzle.

Name: Russia Besieged Expansion Kit
Description: Three new scenarios for Russia Besieged: Fall Blau (1942-1943), Zitadelle (1943-1944), and Downfall (1944-1945), plus a Turkey variant that explores the circumstances under which either Germany or Russia might have brought Turkey into the war on their side.

Name: Apfelhexe
Description:
In this HABA game,each player tries to be the first to collect five apples. There is a special die with three different side:

    Green spot: Hide an apple under the table.
    Red Spot: Hide the Apple Witch.
    Magpie: Helps players to steal other players apple.


Choose a player and try to steal him an apple or the witch.
If this player doesn't have anything, you must give him an apple.

Name: The New Linkage
Description:
An innovative card game that breaks the conventional pattern of numbers and alphabets. the new Linkage links up the color dots with its own unique game theory. The game is developed to suit players of different ages and at different levels.

The new Linkage brings fun and join to everyone. And the game "Links" up your relationship with your friends and your family. Try the new Linkage -- you will like it!

The game contain 108 cards (in 3 colors form 1 to 9 and 4 cards each), and 5 different games 
"Lucky Draw"
"Never - mind"
"Consective Linkage"
"Suvivor"
"Pairing & Linking"

The basic linking principle is that, two card can be link in two ways,
1- cards with same number but different color
2- cards with same color with continue number e.g. 1 and 2, 7 and 8

Name: You Don't Know Jack
Description:
Where high culture and pop culture collide... on your game table. This is a table-top implementation of Jellyvision's (now known as Jackbox Games) irreverent CD-ROM/online trivia game.

"Hosted" by wisecracking "Nate Shapiro" (game creator Harry Gottlieb), the game serves as a scorekeeper of dollar values won or lost answering sublimely-worded trivia questions. The game's hard-coded database tracks questions by code, dollar value, and correct answer. A question's code is entered, the question is read aloud by a player, and a sliding door reveals four multiple-choice answers. Players race to buzz in, either to answer or to "screw" an opponent by forcing the opponent to answer. The game reveals whether or not players answer correctly and adjusts scores accordingly. High score after ten questions wins.

Includes 125 question cards with 500 total general knowledge questions. At least two expansions were released--a TV Pack and a Movies Pack--each adding 113 cards with 450 (TV) or 452 (Movies) additional questions in the set's given subject. (More expansion sets may have been planned, but were not released.)

Name: En Route Game
Description:
This game features a map of Europe across which players travel via train and sea.  They have a number of sea tickets, rail passes, and passports with which to complete the task.

Year published, 1920, is just a guess.

Name: Shantu
Description:
Shan Tu is a combination of Halma and Checkers that features a three-cornered board made up of a grid of circles, each connected with up to six adjacent circles.  (The board could easily be drawn with hexagons instead of circles and lines.)  The game is meant for three players but can be played by two.  Its pieces (ten per player) begin in one corner and move to an opponent's starting corner to be crowned, then must move to one of three central circles in order to win the game.  The first player to get one king to the central circles wins.  Pieces, be they ordinary un-promoted pieces or Kings, may move in any direction and capture opposing pieces by jumping.  Kings have no advantage other than that they are required to win the game.

According to The International Society for Board Game Studies, Shan Tu dates back at least to an 1895 advertisement describing it as "A worthy successor to Gobang, Reversi, Halma and other favourites."

Name: Hoppla Elefant!
Description:
Raja, which is a baby elephant, is in a porcelain shop. He must be very careful not to break porcelain goods.
Some columns are place on the way of the elephant, with porcelain goods on them.
Players must try to avoid these columns while moving the elephant that has a trunk tree in his trunk.
Several difficulty levels are available.

Name: Flippity Frogs
Description:
From the back of the box:

The fast-flipping game of high-flying fun!

Flip, fall, fetch! Open the board and fill the pond.
Use the flipper and flip your frog in. Land on a piece and it's yours. Collect the most pieces to win!

Includes:
1 game board
26 board pieces
4 seesaw flippers
4 frog markers
instructions for 2 levels of play

Ages 4 and up

Name: Song of Rooks and Pawns
Description:
This is a short and free expansion for the Song of Blades and Heroes skirmish wargame. It uses chess pieces and a chess board (alternative rules are included for using chess pieces on standard Song of Blades and Heroes terrain).

Each player commands the usual named pieces in chess: 1 King, 1 Queen, 2 Bishops, 2 Knights, and 2 Rooks. Before the game begins, the player has the opportunity to swap out named pieces for pawns (at the rate of 2 pawns per piece exchanged). Each playing piece has it's own special rules (all contained in the Song of Blades and Heroes rulebook, no other expansion is necessary).

The aim of the game is to take out your opponent's King by killing him or making him flee the board. Although chess pieces and board are used, this is not a chess variant - it is Song of Blades and Heroes to use with your chess set. The pieces retain the character of their equivalent pieces in chess, within the SBH setting.

The idea of Song of Rooks and Pawns is to offer a gateway introduction to the Song of Blades and Heroes system.
Families: Series: Song of Blades and Heroes

Name: Kampf um die Sterne
Description:
English Description:
"Fight for the Stars" depends on its, first 1986 finnished predecessor "Space War". 
This Space Based Battle and Strategygame, let the Players send their Fleets in Epic Space Battles. But the Administration and Structuring of your Empire would be same important as Battletactics. Building new colonies, design Starships and Collecting new Benefits of Technology are only a Handfull of the Possibillities from the Game. Refight the epic Historical Battles of the "First Terra" and and determine the Future of the Earth und from their Allies as well as from their enemies....

"The first Scoutships returned from its long, adventurous journeys. They report of new, unexplored worlds. At the same time they also told, that outside, between the stars, the terrible Fury of the war is ruling the Stars. A young empire stands in the fight against five allies, with one another star realms. Both sides look for worlds, which they can exploit them either, or allied it to their Star Realms. Without the want of mankind they are thrown into the swirling maelstrom. Thus begins then for mankind the "FIGHT FOR THE STARS"...

Historical Scenarios:
A. "Against all odds"
B. "Cry for Freedom"
C. "Slavehunters"
D. "The burning Skies"
E. "Target: EARTH"
F. "The Hand of Faith..."
G. "The Two Crosses"
I. "Fight for the Earth"
H. "Dolchstoß..." (Knife impact?)
J. "Changing the Frontiers"
K. "Descent to Hell"
L. "Jump in the Fire"

The Time Scedule for the History, from 2051 up to 2200 will be added soon as possible...

German Description: Kampf um die Sterne beruht auf dem erstmals 1986 fertiggestellten Vorläufer Space War. Bei dem Weltraumkampf und Strategiespiel Schicken die Spieler Ihre Flotten in epische Weltraumschlachten. Doch der Aufbau und die Verwaltung eures Sternenreiches sollte euch ebenso beanspruchen wie die Kampftaktik. Kolonien gründen, Raumschiffe entwerfen und die Technologie weiterentwickeln sind nur wenige der vielen Möglichkeiten des Spiels. In epischen "historischen" Gefechten kann die Zukunft der Erde und ihrer Verbündeten bestimmt werden.

"Die ersten Scoutschiffe sind von ihren langen, abenteuerlichen Reisen zurückgekehrt. Sie berichten von neuen, unerforschten Welten. Gleichzeitig verbreiten sie auch die Kunde, daß draußen, zwischen den Sternen, die schreckliche Furie des Krieges tobt.

Ein junges Imperium steht im Kampf gegen fünf miteinander verbündete Sternenreiche. Beide Seiten suchen Welten die sie entweder ausbeuten oder zu Verbündeten machen können.

Ohne daß die Menschheit es wollte wird auch sie in den Strudel des Verderbens hineingerissen.

So beginnt dann für die Menschheit der

KAMPF UM DIE STERNE

A. Das Basisspiel

KAMPF UM DIE STERNE ist ein Spiel für maximal sieben Personen ab 12 Jahren. Ziel des Spieles ist es entweder, nach einer vorher ausgemachten Anzahl von Spielrunden, die meisten Sonnensysteme (Variante A) oder mehr als die Hälfte aller Welten dieses Sternensektors (Variante B), zu beherrschen.

Alternativ können die Szenarien der Hintergrundgeschichte gespielt werden. Näheres dazu im Anhang (E).

3. Die Szenarien

A. "Gegen jede Chance"
B. "Schrei nach Freiheit"
C. "Sklavenjäger"
D. "Der brennende Himmel"
E. "Ziel: ERDE"
F. "Die Hand des Schicksals..."
G. "Die zwei Kreuze"
I. "Kampf um die Erde"
H. "Dolchstoß..."
J. "Frontenwechsel"
K. "Abstieg zur Hölle"
L. "Sprung ins Feuer"

2. Zeittafel

2051
Fünf Sternenvölker beherschen den, die Erde umgebenden, Raumsektor. Sie herrschen durch ihre Wirtschaftsmacht und mit Waffengewalt. Eine einzige unterdrückte, ausgebeutete Welt wagt sich zu wiedersetzen. Ihre einzigen Raumschiffe sind kleine wendige Raumjäger. Ihr Kampf ist "Gegen jede Chance".

2052 - 2082
Ein "Schrei nach Freiheit" breitet sich über die Welten des Sektors aus. Eine unterdrückte Welt nach der anderen schließt sich den Rebellen an. Diese Welten gründen die Konföderation von Konquerein.

2061
Die fünf Sternenmächte gründen eine Allianz um gemeinsam gegen die Rebellen vorzugehen.

2097
nachdem mehr als 1.500.000 Menschen von allierten Sklavenjägern entführt worden sind wird endlich eine wirkliche Weltföderation gegründet. Beginn der Aufstellung einer Strategischen Raumflotte unter dem neugegründeten Strategischen Raumverteidigungskommando.

2098
Die "Sklavenjäger" fallen massiv ins Solarsystem ein. Die Terranische Raumflotte wird in erste verlustreiche Kämpfe verwickelt.

2111
Gründung des Interstellaren Terranischen Scoutdienstes (ISTS).

2113 
Das erste Terranische Scoutschiff, die Magellan, bricht zu ihrer langen Reise nach Barnards Stern auf.
Ihre Schwesterschiffe, die Columbus und die Vasco da Gama, brechen nur wenige Wochen später, nach Alpha Centauri und Proxima Centauri, auf.

2127 
Barnards Stern wird durch eine unbekannte Waffe zur Supernova. Die Magellan entkommt da sie von einem, Zeitfeld in die Vergangenheit geschleudert wird.

2131
Die Columbus kehrt als erstes Terranisches Scoutschif, von ihrer Reise zum Alpha Centauri, zurück.
Rückkehr der Magellan.

2137
Das erste Terranische Raumschiff mit Hyperraumantrieb, die Sindbad, startet zu ihrer abenteuerlichen Reise.

2159
Erster Angriff, durch eine Velkandrische Flotte, auf die Erde. Gleichzeitig erreicht die Plasmastoßdruckwelle der Barnardsstern Supernova die Erde. "Der brennende Himmel" wird zum Fanal einer neuen Epoche.

2160
Eine Velkandrische Flotte ist unterwegs das "Ziel ERDE" zu erobern. Die beinahe unverteidigte Erde wird erobert.

2161 
"Die Hand des Schicksals" führt Henry St. George, einen von allierten Sklavenjägern entführten Terraner nach Konquerein. Er wird vom Rat von Konquerein mit der Aufgabe betraut der Erde ein Bündnis anzutragen. Die legendäre siebte Flotte von Konquerein stößt zur Erde vor und befreit sie von den Vilarii. 
Unter der Führung von Henry St. George wird Terra zum Verbündeten von Konquerein. "Die zwei Kreuze" von Konquerein und der Erde kämpfen nun gemeinsam gegen die Allianz.

2176
Der "Dolchstoß" des 1. Lordadmirals beendet die Konföderation und hebt in blutigen Kämpfen das Imperium von Konquerein aus der Taufe.

2179
Von Henry St. George selbst vorbereitet wird durch den Scoutdienst die Terranische Revolution ausgelöst und der "Kampf um die Erde" beginnt.
Es kommt zum "Frontenwechsel" bei dem die Erde sich der Allianz anschließt.

2199
Die Völker sind des endlosen Krieges müde geworden. Die Allierten starten eine letzte Großoffensive um endlich den Sieg zu erringen. Es wird ein "Abstieg zur Hölle".

2200
Die Terranische Flotte startet einen letzten verzweifelten Angriff auf das Heimatsystem Konquerein. Die gesamten Streitkräfte der Allianz unternehmen mit allen Einheiten Ablenkungsangriffe entlang der ganzen Front. Es ist ein "Sprung ins Feuer" denn die Aussichten, der Terranischen Flotte, zu siegen scheinen unendlich gering. Doch die Terraner geben sich nicht geschlagen. Denn sie haben noch einen letzten Trumpf in der Hand...

Name: Götter, Helden, Opferlämmer...
Description:
English Description:
The Game is Made for up to 8 Players.
Quadratic Game Tiles represent the Landscape similar to Kings and Things and other Games of this Kind. Villages, Cities, a Main City, Castle, mines and more are Markings of the Realms from the Players. But also Battles will be there. Knights and Heroes, Farmers and shepherds must be recruited, to steal your enemies Sheep... only with enough victim Lambs you can correct benevolent the Gods and shaping new Land... make magic rites and defeat the evil... maybe you can be victorious against your enemies or even the Mighty common Sheep demons... Collect Food and breed Sheep... a structural building Strategy game from a little other kind...

German Description: Das Spiel ist für bis zu 8 Spieler gedacht. viereckicke Geländeteile ähnlich wie bei Kings and Things oder siedler von Catan stellen die Landschaft dar. Auf dieser Landschaft haben die Spieler Ihre Reiche mit Dörfern, Städten, Burgen usw... Doch auch Kampf gibt es zu oft... Ritter und Helden Bauern und Hirten werden aufgeboten um dem Gegner die Schaafe zu stehlen... denn nur mit genügend Opferlämmern kannst du deine Götter gnädig stimmen und neues Land schaffen... Zauber wirken... und dem Bösen begegnen... ja sogar vielleicht die gemeinen Schaafsdämonen besiegen... Nahrung sammeln und Schaafe züchten... ein Aufbaustrategiespiel der etwas anderen Art...

No English Rules available at present time!

Name: Quatrix
Description:
Quatrix is a two-player game with old world qualities. If you like Backgammon, this game is for you. You must use your best strategies along with the luck of the dice in order to win!

Rings and discs are used in Quatrix. When a disc and a ring are combined, they form a PiP (piece inside piece). Squeezing the ring with the disc inside allows the player to move both pieces together. There are two sets of PiPs in each color, seven pips in each set, and two sets of dice.

All the playing pieces are set up as PiPs on the starting tracks. Players will separate their PiPs as the game progresses. The first player to get his or her pieces reassembled as PiPs across the finish line of the same color wins the game.

Rings, discs, and PiPs can move horizontally and vertically backwards and forwards, but never diagonally. Pieces can jump rings and discs, but you may not jump over a PiP of the opposing color. The board is 7 squares wide by 11 squares long, and has a starting track on each end, and a finish line on the opposite side of the board six tracks away.

(From the instructions)

Name: SCORE!
Description:
From the designer's Etsy listing (Etsy seller fun4thecar):

"This is a travel game I created after many trips with my nieces and members of our youth group. Simply roll the colored die. Match the color rolled on the die to the color on the chart and begin your search! Whoever finds the correct number of items first wins the round. Don't forget to shout "Score!" as you spot items along the road."

Laminated 3-1/2 x 5-3/4 card printed with the color-coded chart indicating the items you're looking for (ex: 4 yellow cars) and two scoring tracks. Comes in a ziplock with 2 tiny clothes pins to track your score on the scoring track and a custom D6.

Name: World of Dorkness
Description:
Published in Issue #11 of Dork Tower

From the rules intro:

"In World of Dorkness, you play one of the Goths of Mud Bay. It's Saturday Night, and you've decided to prove that you're the Alpha Goth by collecting the perfect clique and bringing it to Club Succubus, the Alternative Club. The only trouble is that the Goths of Mud Bay are scattered all over town, and fickle, and collecting the clique will be a tough job."

You'll need the board (included in the comic), a pawn for each player and 24D10 (6 each in 4 different colors or patterns).

Name: Heavy Gear Demo Game
Description:
From the introduction:

This introductory game contains a basic version of the Heavy Gear tabletop rules that is easy to learn and fast to play. It does not require the use of the rulebook or any of the older Heavy Gear supplements. The Heavy Gear Demo Game includes ten cut-out Gear counters, one color arena map and a condensed version of the tactical rules. All you need is pen, paper and a few six-sided dice!

Stock number: DP9-100
ISBN-13: 9781894814096

Name: Lightning Strike Demo Game
Description:
This demo game, printed on a folded single sheet of paper, contains the game basic rules, an introduction to the setting, cut-out counters, rulers and data-sheets for the following vehicles: Pathfinder, Lancer, Syreen, Wraith.

Stock number: DP9-300
ISBN-13: 9781894814102

Name: Gear Krieg Demo Game
Description: This demo game, printed on a folded single sheet of paper, contains the game basic rules, a game map, cut-out counters, rulers and data-sheets for American and German infantry and vehicles (M11A3 General Early and PzKpf V Ausf 'B' Valkurie).

Name: Bob the Builder: Tricky Tool Box
Description: This fun action game is great for children 3 plus. Bob's toolbox spins around opening and closing as it goes and the players have to flick all of their coloured tools into the box first to be the winner. Be quick though as the tricky little toolbox keeps throwing them back out! Great fun for upto 4 people.

Name: Stip Stap
Description:
Choose a Disney-mat and stand on it. Wait until the dice are thrown and hear what is being called. For example: Goofy says "stand on one leg". If you are on the Goofy-mat, you must complete this mission within 5 seconds, otherwise you are off. Players now doing same, but not on the right figure? Too bad, you are also off. Change of mat will occur occasionally and be aware if somebody throws Mickey..
The last player remaining wins the game.

Age: from 3 years

Contents: 
- 6 Disney mats 
- 2 special dice 
- Rules

Name: Hershey's Kisses Counting Game
Description: Players move their tokens around a board decorated with Hershey's candies in an effort to collect enough candies to win the game. No decision-making is involved.

Name: Baby's Coming Bingo
Description: Similar to standard bingo except each person picks one of the words from their board and has to relate a story or give advice to the mother to be. The bingo game is actually one of several games that come in the box. Other games include "Guess the waistline of the mother to be", where the mother stands in the middle of the room and everyone guesses her waist in inches. "Last woman standing" where the women receive chips with baby shower related words and every time someone says their own word by accident they lose a chip. Last woman to have a chip wins.

Name: Blue Sea / Blue Sky: Aerial Combat in the Mediterranean Theatre, 1940-1943
Description:
Aerial Combat in the Mediterranean Theater, 1940-1943.

Blue Sea / Blue Sky is a collection of scenarios, campaign systems, aircraft data cards and new rules for use with the Red Sun/Blue Sky miniature games. This book recreates tactical aerial combat in the Mediterranean Theater in WW II, from 1940 - 1943, and includes stats for 10 Allied, and 32 Axis aircraft. Four solitaire scenarios, eight standard scenarios, and a mini-campaign included with the rules.

Name: Scarabs & Scorpions
Description:
What did all those laborers of the great Egyptian monuments do with their time off?  Just like us, they played games!

This exciting dice game is a race to the best score.  Will the ancient Atum bless you with many Scarabs or will you be plagued by the Scorpions of Hedetet?

Players roll the dice trying for special scoring combinations, but, just when you think you have a good score, another player rolls the Scorpion die!  Will you be Stung?

Name: Bob the Builder: Barrow Up Bob!
Description:
2 players take turns placing tools onto Bob's wheelbarrow.  Eventually Bob decides he's had enough and will tip the lot onto the floor or earlier if the players are heavy handed. The player who causes it to fall gets penalty points.  The player with the least penalty points at the end of the game is the winner.

The game features a nice plastic model of Bob that holds the wheel barrow in place for children to place the tools. The wheel barrow itself features a mechanism that when triggered tips the barrow up and tools out.  Very much like Buckaroo!.
